subtitle: Celeriac is a wonderful sweet nutty tasting vegetable and makes an unusual and satisfying starter when French fried.

method.text: Cut celeriac into quarters. Then slice into 5mm slices. Cook in boiling water with the lemon juice for 5 min. Drain well.
Return celeriac to the pan. Shake over a low heat to dry off. Allow to cool.
Mix the breadcrumbs with the herbs and nuts. Dip the celeriac slices in the egg white. Drain well. Coat in the breadcrumbs, pressing them down firmly.
Heat the oil in a large pan to 190°C. or until a cube of bread browns in 40 seconds.
Deep fry the coated celeriac in small batches for about 3 min until crisp and golden. Drain well on crumpled kitchen paper.

title: Crispy fried celeriac triangles
